conclusion: Consider principles of total internal reflection and geometry.
Laser beam injected at point O with incident angle α = 45°.
Total internal reflection occurs at the side of the optical fiber.
Total internal reflection occurs when angle of incidence is greater than critical angle.
Critical angle θc is given by θc = sin⁻¹(n2/n1).
n1 is refractive index of core, n2 is refractive index of cladding.
Angle of incidence inside fiber after entering from point O is α = 45°.
Angle θ is between laser beam and normal at point of incidence.
Angle θ is related to α by geometry of situation.
Since beam is injected at 45° and total reflection occurs, θ must reflect back into core.
θ is complement of α because beam reflects off side of fiber.
